resources.string: %1$s requires one or more Google Play services that are not currently available. Please contact the developer for assistance.
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your phone."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your tablet."
The specified account does not exist on this device. Please choose a different account.
A data connection is required to connect to Google Play services.
Accessing accounts from a restricted profile is not supported.
Error signing in the specified account. Please choose a different account.
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. If the problem persists, please contact the developer for assistance.
%1$s relies on Google Play services, which is not supported by your device. Contact the manufacturer for assistance.
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
Add family members to follow their weight info
Change the batteries and connect the scale again
You can add up to 10 alarms with Mi Band 2
Tap the band to stop alarm
"Tap the band to make it stop vibrating. It will vibrate again in 10 minutes."
You can add up to 3 alarms with Mi Band
Tap the button to set an alarm
Allow access to SD card in the Settings
Allow Mi Band to access camera in the Settings
"Can't read or write files on SD card"
"Mi Band will vibrate when it's disconnected"
"Using mobile data may create additional traffic costs. Update anyway?"
Current version is up to date
"Mi Band alerts These apps can show their icons on Mi Band: WeChat, QQ, Facebook, Twitter, Mi Talk, Sina Weibo, Snapchat, Amazfit, Mi Fit, Taobao. For example, WeChat: "

"Couldn't pair, check network and try again."

Put the scale on the flat surface and step on top
Step on the scale to pair

Android version should be 4.4 or later
The phone should support Bluetooth 4.0 or higher

Bluetooth is not working properly. Wait a minute or two and try again.
Buy a Mi Band to make your life smarter

Keep the band close to your phone

"Couldn't measure heart rate. Fasten the band."
Mi Band is connected to the phone via Bluetooth. The closer the devices are to each other, the easier it is to find the band.
"If the phone doesn't find the band even when it's close, maybe the band is out of power. Charge the band and try again."
"If the band is charged, and the phone still can't find it, try restarting phone's Bluetooth."
If your band is paired with another nearby phone, turn off Bluetooth on that phone, and then search for the band on this one.
Open Mi Fit again after you reboot your phone
Is your band too far away?
Is this band paired with another device?
Keep band connected to device via Bluetooth

Fasten your band tightly to increase the accuracy of the data
Mi Band Pulse and Mi Band 2 are equipped with a heart rate sensor

Ideal heart rate during workout sessions for different ages
"Ideal heart rate during workout sessions: 60%-80% from maximum aerobic heart rate (220-age)"
Connect Mi Band Pulse or Mi Band 2 to measure heart rate.
For example: Jack is 20, his ideal heart rate during workout sessions is 120-160 BPM (220-20=200, 200×60%=120, 200×80%=160).
Pair Mi Band to use Discoverable mode
Turn on to be visible to nearby devices
Keep band connected to device via Bluetooth

Install or remove the core from the back of Mi Band strap
"Place both feet firmly on the center of the scale."

"When the scale's batteries need to be replaced, the scale will show you this"
If the following prompt is blinking, maximum weight was exceeded.
Place the scale on a dry surface
Make sure Mi Fit app is open when you weigh in
After batteries are replaced, the scale will restart automatically.
Mi Scale can measure weight up to 150 kg
Make sure you stand on the center of the scale

World Health Organization recommends to exercise for 40 minutes daily (walk ~8000 steps)
World Health Organization recommends to exercise for 60 minutes daily (walk ~12000 steps)

Running Insurance expires in %1$d days, tap to renew

Pause automatically when session is interrupted

"Couldn't share, check if there's enough free storage"
"You won't be able to restore items after you delete them."
Get to a place with better GPS signal to continue
Who can try landing on their forefeet when running
Stick to your own running habits
"We don't recommend changing your running habits. If you choose to land on your midfeet and heels, wear shoes with better cushioning to reduce the impact of landing."
When your knees require more protection, you can try landing on your forefeet more following the routine below
Strike the ground right below you, keep your knees slightly bent, lean your body forward
Run as if you were rotating a hot wheel with your feet
Make smaller steps when you increase running speed.
Connect running shoes and make sure you land on your forefeet
"Turn on Bluetooth and connect shoes before running. Keep Bluetooth on when running"
Striking the ground with your forefeet requires stronger calf muscles and Achilles tendons; landing on your midfeet or heels strongly affects your knees
Running shoes needed to display forefeet data

"When your knees require more protection, you can try landing on your forefeet more following the routine below.
1) Strike the ground right below you, keep your knees slightly bent, lean your body forward."
2) Run as if you were rotating a hot wheel with your feet.
3) Make smaller steps when you increase running speed

"Fasten the band as tightly as you feel comfortable. Wearing too tight or too loose will affect the heart rate results.
Wear the band at the right position around your wrist (except the thinnest part)"
Mi Band Pulse and Mi Band 2 are equipped with a heart rate sensor
Your exercise heart rate zone is calculated as below. Select the appropriate heart rate zone can significantly increase the exercise efficiency
Step frequency is the number of steps you make per minute when running.
Runners usually increase their stride to gain speed. However, using this method can result in muscle damage. You can try to increase your step frequency to gain speed.
Long-distance runners usually make 180 steps per minute. We recommend using this value as your step frequency goal
Connect Mi Band to make sure your step frequency is detected.
"Turn on Bluetooth and connect Mi Band before running. Keep Bluetooth on when running"
Pace is one of the speed definitions, generally used in a marathon, means the time duration to finish 1 km.
Keep a uniform speed is the key, so steady curve in the Graph means you controlled well.
Pace can be measured easier. During a marathon, you can adjust your pace according to the split time of a certain distance
Why not use speed per hour?

When running slowly, most people would naturally land on their midfeet or heels. When the running speed increases, more people would strike the ground with their forefeet. For example, most sprinters choose to land on their forefeet when running
Landing on your midfeet or heels strongly affects your knees. Striking the ground with your forefeet requires stronger calf muscles and Achilles tendons
Pace is one of the speed definitions, generally used in a marathon, means the time duration to finish 1 km.

"Tempo run needs a good control and plan of your physical strength. Strength distribution is the key to a long-distance running, and it depends on the pace you planned to have. With different speeds used, tempo run can divide into easy run, long run and lactate-threshold run, etc. A consistent and continuous speed is needed and beneficial to exert your strength fully in a marathon."
Stride means the distance covered by a step when walking or running
Find the fittest stride of your own
Appropriate stride should be: landing on your midfeet or forefeet to make the landing point fall close to the center of gravity, and press down the foot backward to hold on to the ground
Long-distance runners usually make 180 steps per minute. We recommend using this value as your step frequency goal
Step frequency is the number of steps you make per minute when running.
Runners usually increase their stride to gain speed. However, using this method can result in muscle damage. You can try to increase your step frequency to gain speed.

For most amateur runners, slow step frequency and big stride will make the landing point of the feet fall in front of the center of gravity. Like braking, it will force you move backwards, thus bring poor energy efficiency and higher risks of injury.

Reboot your device and try using your Mi Band to unlock it.
Keep the band close to your phone
Set up \"Unlock with Bluetooth device\" again

Mi Scale is connected to the phone via Bluetooth. The closer the devices are to each other, the easier it is to find the scale.
Try to weigh in. If the battery icon is displayed on the scale, replace the batteries.
"If the scale doesn't respond during weigh-in, check if the batteries are installed properly."
"If there's enough battery power, but the phone still can't find the scale, try restarting Bluetooth."
After you follow the steps above, exit and open Mi Fit again to connect to the scale.
Is your scale too far away?
"Wait until the LED notification light stops blinking before stepping off the scale."
Merge weigh-ins by the same user within 30s from each other
